channel.title: Uncategorized on Huh, with Mat
channel.description: Recent content in Uncategorized on Huh, with Mat

item.description:
it is not just a feeling 
but quite an ache where feeling fled.
it left for greener pastures
where lonely men have yet to tread.
it was a full-formed stasis
with little much for me to dread.
it came and went with passion,
now passion’s empty in its stead.

item.title: last words on the ending
item.description:
why should i be like the creation of a star,
space gases imploding
just to one day shine brightly
on a world he’ll inhabit with another.
i am not a fucking star.
i am a universe
of pent-up energy
with life undiscovered.

i have worth
beyond the feeling of his fingertips.

item.title: lamentation.
item.description:
at least his arms, lord.
i have no internal compass
to direct myself in their absence.

or even his hands, father?
with their sinewed grip
on this flighty heart.

dayspring of a hope misplaced,
protector of a man disgraced,

i’ve lost his comfort, abba,
and for my wickedness and sin:
i’m left to know the dark again.

Oh!
For a moment he fell in step,
arms and legs
swinging to the pace I set, and
Oh!
How my heart had shook,
rumbled in my chest
from every look I took, or
Oh!
What a ride it became,
slipping from my skin
as we danced to make rain, yet
Oh.
Still a lot to be learned,
as the demons came out
screaming ’bout the life they’d earned, for
oh.
He could really twist out a song,
mouth and hands
moving withouta foot in the wrong, yet
oh.
There wasn’t much I could say,
for my paper-thin skin
burnt by the harsh light of day, so
oh.
I let the moments slip by,
’til I turned my step
away as to not watch it die, and
…

My momma’s a quiet woman.
Between the cracks ‘round her eyes and the cracks spreading out from her mouth you’d think she led a good life ‘til now. Probably a looker in high-school with a smile and a laugh that wrecked every boy brave enough to chat her up. I wouldn’t know though. She doesn’t say much.
I bugged her so bad once that she showed me what was inside the top-left dresser drawer. Its key was a long, brass piece with three teeth that never left her neck. When she finally pulled the drawer open all that was inside was a scratched tin box. Her gentle fingers lifted it and she placed it on the bed. She removed the lid and I peered inside. There were some crayons, a rock, a small box of rolling papers, and a long, white satin glove folded neatly.
My momma made no sense.

item.title: x
item.description:
I lost the king:       now this hand is no good
for
I borrowed dreams:     formed as though driftwood
while
this heart slept:      floated without reason
and
his soul wept:         'til I ended my treason

i dream of tears, i dream of floating
falling slow with nothing showing
in the dark i am glowing
a weightless thing that’s merely floating.

i saw the sun, the lion’s singing
the witch escaped: her words unstinging.
a restless heart, in time, is beating
it calls to join that hopeful singing.

there is no time, the voice will lament
the lion feasts until it is spent.
out goes the sun, a final event:
in this silence there is no lament.

sway close
ready your self with my self

until dawn
these streets we’ll be wandering

sway close
street-splashed water fills your shoes

until dawn
when the sun steals our moments

sway close
tomorrow exists not for us

wouldn’t it be nice
if they weren’t all right?
perhaps this soul
could rediscover its light
and stop chasing a reflection.

item.title: Lusting leaves me distant.
item.description:
Boy, I don’t think I’ve told you,
lest I show myself a fright.
In dreams, I take delight
in letting fingertips sail
around your curves.
My eyes scan down your flesh,
willing every inch of skin
closer and closer to my own.
Persperation fails to cool
as we grasp each other tighter.
United, we connect
our lonely bodies; find
something worthy of holding.
I long for this to be unfolding
but in words it’ll remain, unknown.

item.title: April 3
item.description:
Damnation is here
I am stricken by the sound
Of soulless release

item.title: April 2
item.description:
To this day there’ve been no whispers,
in the distance I’ve seen no ships
calling out to warn or welcome;
in this harbor warm and wet.
Just a child when I sat in earnest
awaiting the arms of an absentee.
I sought and strove as I grew sensible,
while my heart, withdrawn, learned its beat.

It’d be false to claim I’d left it thusly.
Only a bit older did I opt to open
and let its rhythm reach beyond my writ.
[unfinished]

item.title: April 1
item.description:
I led the wind
   Oh he’d left no trace
back to the time
   spent up every
where we grew up
   ward of my mind’s
eyes pained with guilt
   free moments.

When fatigue becomes emotion
   birthing such a bitter force,
  it lacks an empathy well-known.
In response to great commotion
   from a personable source,
  anger sets where love had flown.
